Sentencas: Since the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) has fuel flexibility, high electrical efficiency, and environmental benefits, it is considered a promising electrochemical energy-conversion device.
Titulo: A comprehensive study and tri-objective optimization for an efficient waste heat recovery from solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: However, it is important to include a waste heat recovery (WHR) unit in SOFC due the high operating temperature.
Titulo: A comprehensive study and tri-objective optimization for an efficient waste heat recovery from solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In the present work, the integration of SOFC and WHR is developed.
Titulo: A comprehensive study and tri-objective optimization for an efficient waste heat recovery from solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Accordingly, a parametric evaluation of the critical variables from energy, exergy, exergoeconomic, and environmental (4E) viewpoints is carried out.
Titulo: A comprehensive study and tri-objective optimization for an efficient waste heat recovery from solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: To determine the optimal decision variables, a tri-objective optimization is performed on the novel integrated SOFC-WHR system; the Pareto frontier solution is also provided.
Titulo: A comprehensive study and tri-objective optimization for an efficient waste heat recovery from solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: On the Pareto curve, the ultimate solution is selected employing the TOPSIS method.
Titulo: A comprehensive study and tri-objective optimization for an efficient waste heat recovery from solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The objective functions are cost rate, output power, and CO2 emission, and the corresponding optimal values are identified as 28.5 $/GJ, 1368 kW, and 0.205 kg/kWh, respectively.
Titulo: A comprehensive study and tri-objective optimization for an efficient waste heat recovery from solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Moreover, the scattered distribution of nine design variables is explored, and the behavior of decision variables is obtained.
Titulo: A comprehensive study and tri-objective optimization for an efficient waste heat recovery from solid oxide fuel cell
